About Me

I design and build websites for small businesses. I also take over upgrade and management of websites that have fallen by the wayside. I'm based near Inverness in the Scottish Highlands.

In 1999 I created the Scottish and Celtic music specialist retail website Music Scotland. I ran this business as owner-manager from locations in Edinburgh, Stirling and the Isle of Mull. In 2005 the business won the Scots Trad Music Awards Services To Industry Award. In 2011 it was sold as a going concern to another Scottish music store, Oban Music.
Music Scotland has sent CDs, DVDs and books to tens of thousands of customers worldwide, most of this music created by Scottish artists.

Since 2011 I’ve worked freelance, creating and/or supporting an operational web presence for a wide range of client businesses. These have included record companies and other online retailers, accommodation providers, agricultural suppliers and medical-scientific organisations.

Between 2017 and 2019 I was part of the Webteam at the University of the Highlands and Islands, working on the University’s content management system, supporting users and developing the front end of the website.

I live on the rural Black Isle, near Inverness in the Scottish Highlands, with my wife and two children. I own and manage Back Brae Lodge, a self catering holiday cottage in Tobermory on the Isle of Mull.

In a former life I was a musician, performing internationally with Salsa Celtica and other bands, and teaching Scottish traditional music with Feisean Nan Gaidheal.

In an even former life, Edinburgh University gave me a degree in Biochemistry.

Web Business Services - Web Design and Front End Web Development - Inverness, Scottish Highlands
